text: Philippines's 9th senatorial district, officially the Ninth Senatorial District of the Philippine Islands (), was one of the twelve senatorial districts of the Philippines in existence between 1916 and 1935. It elected two members to the Senate of the Philippines, the upper chamber of the bicameral Philippine Legislature under the Insular Government of the Philippine Islands for each of the 4th to 10th legislatures. The district was created under the 1916 Jones Law from the eastern Visayas provinces of Leyte and Samar. The district was represented by a total of six senators throughout its existence. It was abolished in 1935 when a unicameral National Assembly was installed under a new constitution following the passage of the Tydings–McDuffie Act which established the Commonwealth of the Philippines. Since the 1941 elections when the Senate was restored after a constitutional plebiscite, all twenty-four members of the upper house have been elected countrywide at-large. It was last represented by José María Veloso and José Avelino of the Nacionalista Democrático. ==List of senators== {| class=wikitable |- ! colspan=7 | Seat A | rowspan=99 | ! rowspan=3 | Legislature | rowspan=99 | ! colspan=7 | Seat B |- style="height:3em" ! rowspan="2" | # ! rowspan="2" colspan=2 | Senator ! colspan=2 | Term of office ! rowspan="2" | Party ! rowspan="2" | Electoral history ! rowspan="2" | # ! rowspan="2" colspan=2 | Senator ! colspan=2 | Term of office ! rowspan="2" | Party ! rowspan="2" | Electoral history |- !Start!!End !Start!!End |- | rowspan="2" style="text-align:center;" | 1 | rowspan="2" style="background:;" | | rowspan="2" | Esteban Singson | rowspan="2" | October 16, 1916 | rowspan="2" | June 6, 1922 | rowspan="2" | Nacionalista | rowspan="2" | Elected in 1916. | style="text-align:center;" | 4th | style="text- align:center;" | 1 | style="background:;" | | José María Veloso | October 16, 1916 | June 3, 1919 | Nacionalista | Elected in 1916. |- | style="text- align:center;" | 5th | rowspan="2" style="text-align:center;" | 2 | style="background:;" | | rowspan="2" | Francisco Enage | rowspan="2" | June 3, 1919 | rowspan="2" | June 2, 1925 | Nacionalista | rowspan="2" | Elected in 1919. |- | rowspan="2" style="text-align:center;" | 2 | style="background- color:#191970 | | rowspan="2" | Tomás Gómez | rowspan="2" | June 6, 1922 | rowspan="2" | July 28, 1926 | Nacionalista Colectivista | rowspan="2" | Elected in 1922. Died. | style="text-align:center;" | 6th | style="background-color:#191970 | | Nacionalista Colectivista |- | style="background:;" | | Nacionalista Consolidado | rowspan="2" style="text-align:center;" | 7th | rowspan="5" style="text-align:center;" | (1) | rowspan="4" style="background- color:#0000FF| | rowspan="5" | José María Veloso | rowspan="5" | June 2, 1925 | rowspan="5" | September 16, 1935 | rowspan="4" | Demócrata | rowspan="3" | Elected in 1925. |- | style="text-align:center;" | 3 | style="background:;" | | Pastor Salazar | December 30, 1926 | June 5, 1928 | Nacionalista Consolidado | Elected to finish Gómez's term. |- | rowspan="3" style="text- align:center;" | 4 | rowspan="2" style="background-color:#0000FF| | rowspan="3" | José Avelino | rowspan="3" | June 5, 1928 | rowspan="3" | September 16, 1935 | rowspan="2" | Demócrata | rowspan="2" | Elected in 1928. | style="text-align:center;" | 8th |- | style="text-align:center;" | 9th | rowspan="2" | Re-elected in 1931. |- | style="background:;" | | Nacionalista Democrático | Re-elected in 1934. | style="text-align:center;" | 10th | style="background:;" | | Nacionalista Democrático |} ==See also== *Legislative districts of the Philippines ==References== Category:Senatorial districts of the Philippines Category:1916 establishments in the Philippines Category:1935 disestablishments in the Philippines Category:Politics of Leyte (province) Category:Politics of Samar (province)
